title: Noah Cyrus and Fleet Foxes Come Together for New Song “Don’t Put It All on Me”: Watch the Video
description: Fresh off a collaboration with Bill Callahan, Cyrus duets with Robin Pecknold
author: Matthew Strauss
excerpt: Fresh off a collaboration with Bill Callahan, Cyrus duets with Robin Pecknold
text: Noah Cyrus recently collaborated with Bill Callahan and XL Recordings’ Richard Russell on the song “Porcupine Tattoo.” Now, Miley Cyrus’ younger sister is staying in her indie bag through a new collaboration with Fleet Foxes. On her new single, “Don’t Put It All on Me,” Noah Cyrus duets with the band’s lead singer, Robin Pecknold. Watch the track’s new music video, directed by Luis Villanueva, below.Braison Cyrus wrote “Don’t Put It All on Me.” In a statement, Noah Cyrus said of her brother, “I have always been the observer in our family, and Braison wrote about how I tend to carry the weight of that on my shoulders.”Noah Cyrus released her debut studio album, The Hardest Part, in 2022. Regarding her new music, she said, “I want my music to offer fans a sense of comforting, peaceful nostalgia. That’s something that I feel so heavily when I listen to music. We all want to connect with our past while also being aware of the present moment. Music does that for me, and this new collection of songs was made with that in mind. I want to evoke that feeling of a comforting friend that a song can be—and allow us all to heal.”Revisit the 2020 interview “Fleet Foxes’ Robin Pecknold on the John Prine Song He Wishes He Wrote.”
html:
Noah Cyrus recently collaborated with Bill Callahan and XL Recordings’ Richard Russell on the song “Porcupine Tattoo.” Now, Miley Cyrus’ younger sister is staying in her indie bag through a new collaboration with Fleet Foxes. On her new single, “Don’t Put It All on Me,” Noah Cyrus duets with the band’s lead singer, Robin Pecknold. Watch the track’s new music video, directed by Luis Villanueva, below.

Braison Cyrus wrote “Don’t Put It All on Me.” In a statement, Noah Cyrus said of her brother, “I have always been the observer in our family, and Braison wrote about how I tend to carry the weight of that on my shoulders.”

Noah Cyrus released her debut studio album, The Hardest Part, in 2022. Regarding her new music, she said, “I want my music to offer fans a sense of comforting, peaceful nostalgia. That’s something that I feel so heavily when I listen to music. We all want to connect with our past while also being aware of the present moment. Music does that for me, and this new collection of songs was made with that in mind. I want to evoke that feeling of a comforting friend that a song can be—and allow us all to heal.”

Revisit the 2020 interview “Fleet Foxes’ Robin Pecknold on the John Prine Song He Wishes He Wrote.”
